content.description:
P1. 5.11a. Climb the leftmost face past quartz plates to anchors shared with

Make a Wish

and

Over the Hillary

.
content.protection: 4 bolts and an optional medium cam.

content.description:
Over the Hillary ascends a fun arete.

P1. 5.10b. Climb the arete, turn the roof, and finish at anchors shared with

Make a Wish

.

Make a Wish is one of the best slabs around.

P1. 5.11b. Climb a short section of dirty rock to a beautiful slab crux followed by a tricky move past a roof. The anchors are shared with

Over the Hillary

and

Teller

.

climbs.name: Little Richard Sporter
climbs.fa: a man with balls of steel and hexes

content.description:
Start on first 3 bolts of "

Over the Hillary

". Cross left into the hand crack traverse, up the mini-dihedral to a log. Stay on a rock traverse left to a slanting crack in a mini-headwall. This is where I would set a belay next time (you might even be able to reach ground on other side of 'hump'). It would be pretty comfortable staying on rock, and you would have good crack for anchor.

Pitch two from there would go up diagonally. Make 'bouldery' move (crux) into a horizontal squeeze, then voil√†, the final 5.6 hand crack mantel to the top of this cool buttress. There is a good anchor building opportunity on top.

Walk off right and follow a ridge west a little, then downclimb south.

I cleared ledges of choss, but just a few more ascents, and it would be worth of 4 stars... to a trad climber.
content.protection: A standard rack to 4", and RPs are helpful.
